sections.title: Christ, a Symbol of the Self
sections.thesis: A psychological reading of Christian symbolism as an image of the Self and the problem of excluded opposites.

sections.body: This chapter matters because it clarifies the lens you will use throughout Aion: symbolic tensions are not distractions, but the material of psychological transformation.

terms.definition: A psychological reading of Christ imagery as an archetypal representation of the Self and wholeness.
The archetype of wholeness and psychic totality that orders life beyond the ego standpoint.
Fourfold symbolic structure that images a more complete wholeness than one-sided perfection.
